data.name: kAlreadyRunning
data.value: There is already a copy of FLExBridge running. You probably have a Conflict Report open. It will need to be closed before you can access any of the other FLExBridge functions such as: -- Send/Receive Project -- Receive Project from a colleague -- View Conflict Report (can't have two open)

data.name: kFLExBridge
data.value: FLEx Bridge

data.name: ObtainProjectView_DialogTitle
data.value: Receive project

data.name: kFlexNotListening
data.value: FLEx isn't listening.

data.name: kFlexProjectExists
data.value: Could not obtain the new project, because one with the same name already exists.

data.name: kObtainProject
data.value: Obtain project

data.name: kMovingRepo
data.value: Moving obtained project to final location.

data.name: kEmptyRepoMsg
data.value: This repository has no data in it yet. Before you can get data from this repository, someone needs to send project data to this repository.

data.name: kRepoProblem
data.value: Empty Repository

data.name: kYourVersionIsCurrent
data.value: Your version is current.

data.name: KFlexBridgeVersion
data.value: FLEx Bridge Version

data.name: kNewerVersionAvailablePattern
data.value: Your version is '{0}'. A newer version '{1}' exists. Do you want to download it?

data.name: kHowToSendReceiveExtantRepository
data.value: To Send/Receive that project, open it and use Send/Receive > Project (or Lexicon).

data.name: kCannotCheckForUpdateNow
data.value: Sorry. FLEx Bridge was not able to check for an update right now.

data.name: kCheckForUpdateFailure
data.value: Check for Update Failure

data.name: kFlexUpdateRequired
data.value: You will need to update your version of FLEx to obtain the requested project, since it is newer.

data.name: kFlexUpdateToSupportLift
data.value: Your version of FLEx supports LIFT model version {0}, but the requested project uses the newer version {1}. You will need to update your version of FLEx to obtain the requested lexicon project.

data.name: kInvalidCommandLineOptions
data.value: Invalid command line options. Please launch from FLEx.

data.name: chorus
data.value: ../Resources/chorus.ico;System.Drawing.Icon, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a

data.name: kNoCommandLineOptions
data.value: It looks like you've run FLEx Bridge directly, either at the command line or by double-clicking. If you are trying to Send/Receive your project, please open your project in FLEx and choose the appropriate option from the Send/Receive menu. To learn how to use FLEx Bridge, please open FLEx and choose Send/Receive > Help...
data.comment: Message displayed when FLEx Bridge is run without any command line options
